item.title: ox-hugo
item.description: Compiles Org Mode files to Hugo markdown files, so essentially duplicates a lot of the functionality of Hugo itself, but has the advantage that you don’t need any Hugo-specific syntax in your Org files to make them work. item.title: hugo-orgmode
item.description: Writing Hugo in Org Hugo is a site generator. Among other things it has native support for generating websites from collections of Emacs Org Mode files. What about a link to Emacs It’s as simple as putting .org files in the content/ directory of the the generated site. Hugo has built-in Org Mode support. Hugo will create one page per file. It supports a bunch of different file types out of the box.

item.title: Emacs cheat sheet
item.description: Rename current file: SPC f R (from Spacemacs config) Open config file: SPC f e f (from Spacemacs config probably) Open buffer list: SPC b b Fuzzy file find: SPC p f Reload config (actually restart Emacs but preserve layout): SPC q r Find out what a key is bound to: C-h c <key> Still have not got tables to be able to align properly. Trying multiple different versions, none work Tried multiple fonts (Fira Mono + Source Code Pro), since there was a suggestion that fonts that aren’t properly monospace would cause issues, but this also doesn’t fix anything.
